titles: The vvorlds svveet-heart vvhereby it is shewed that mistris Money, is the worlds sweet-heart and hony. To the tune of, The begger boy.
publisher: for Tho: Lambert, at the signe of the Horshoo in Smithfield,
notes: Verse - "Sweet Mistris money I here will declare,".
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
